endpoint.airbyte.google_ads_source.Googl: Access Token for making authenticated requests. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide.
The Client ID of your Google Ads developer application. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide
The Client Secret of your Google Ads developer application. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide.
Developer Token granted by Google to use their APIs. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide.
The token for obtaining a new access token. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide.

A custom defined GAQL query for building the report. Should not contain segments.date expression as it used by incremental streams. Example: SELECT segments.ad_destination_type, campaign.advertising_channel_sub_type FROM campaign WHERE campaign.status = 'PAUSED'
The table name in your destination database for chosen query
A conversion window is the period of time after an ad interaction (such as an ad click or video view) during which a conversion, such as a purchase, is recorded in Google Ads.

Comma separated list of (client) customer IDs. Each customer ID must be specified as a 10-digit number without dashes. More instruction on how to find this value in Airbyte setup guide. Metrics streams like AdGroupAdReport cannot be requested for a manager account. Example: 6783948572,5839201945
UTC date and time in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Any data before this date will not be replicated. Example: 2017-01-25.
Login Customer ID for Managed Accounts (Optional)

If your access to the customer account is through a manager account, this field is required and must be set to the customer ID of the manager account (10-digit number without dashes). More information about this field you can see Call structure documentation. Example: 7349206847
UTC date and time in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Any data before this date will not be replicated. Example: 2017-01-25
